description: This book aims to teach readers how to use Python language to program and solve problems. The book is equipped with a large number of easy-to-understand examples, pseudo-codes, and flowcharts. Each chapter is also accompanied by learning cases, which are designed to help readers master the method of solving problems through step-by-step analysis. This book introduces basic knowledge such as the working principle of computers, data storage and backup, first outlines the interactive mode, script mode and IDLE environment of the Python language, and then introduces the decision-making structure and Boolean logic of Python, files and exceptions, and lists in turn. With knowledge of tuples, classes and object-oriented programming, event-driven GUI programming is also introduced after *.
